Hola!

El próximo Miércoles 16 de Diciembre quedaremos en linea para hacer la Kata de Score Keeper de forma guiada. Score Keeper es una kata pensada para iniciarse en el TDD y el pair-programming.

title: PyBCN Online: January Meetup
descr:
Architecture Decision Records: documenta tu arquitectura, explica tus decisiones

Héctor Canto, Senior Software Engineer at Smart Protection and member of PyBCN will introduce you into the world of Architecture Decision Records.

Language: Spanish

Abstract:

Una de los aspectos peor documentados de un proyecto de Software es la evolución de la arquitectura. Los ADR os ayudarán a hacer una foto de vuestras decisiones como desarrollador y arquitecto de software, reflexionar sobre tus motiviciones para optar por ciertas soluciones y poner por escrito tus expectativas y riesgos asumidos.

En esta charla veremos qué es un ADR, por qué hacerlo, cuando hacerlo y cómo empezar.

Idioma: Castellano

----------

The talk will be online in YouTube (the current URL is a placeholder that will be modified closer to the talk date).

You will be able to ask written questions during and after the talk in our Slack, in the channel #meetups If you are not a member of our Slack, don't worry, we will send the invite link to all attendees before the talk.

title: 2a Jam Session
descr:
Com vam fer a la primera sessió, la idea és connectar-nos tots en una sala per poder debatre i explorar plegats diferents temes relacionats amb el món de la tecnologia.

Pretenem que sigui un entorn “íntim i segur”, de forma que només farem arribar la sala virtual als membres de la comunitat i en cap cas ni s’enregistrarà ni es publicarà cap stream.

Per exemple, a l’última sessió vàrem explorar temes relacionats amb containerització/orquestració, CI/CD, stacks a prod, experiències i batalletes, …

El format taula rodona dona per molt, i el fet que no hi hagi un guió tancat dóna moltes possibilitats 🙂

Alguns topics dels que podríem parlar:
- async
- CI / CD
- Creació de clis / libs

Si teniu alguna idea, dubtes o teniu ganes de que entre tots explorem algun tema no dubteu en proposar-ho!

No és imprescindible, però si ho avanceu pel grup de PythonGirona uns dies abans ens ho podrem preparar una mica per a dinamitzar-ho tot millor :)

Tancarem amb una ronda de lightning talks

Al final de tot, aprofitarem per entre tots establir els propers passos del grup.

Per cert, recorda portar la teva cervesa :)

T'esperem 💪

title: Practical practicable good practices
descr:
PyData Salamanca is proud to announce a new meetup!

All the talks will be streamed on our Youtube channel.

Youtube Live link: https://youtu.be/mzaMWmJ9jao

AGENDA

18:00 pm - Keynote (Spanish)
Title: Practical practicable good practices.

Abstract:
Whether you are writing a small script for your pet research project or building the next open source big hit in the software world, good development practices are likely to be your friend. In this talk good practices will be tackled from a practical point of view: from explaining the why and finding the right balance when applying them, to discussing examples and existing tools - they are meant to help your present and future self.

Speaker: Diego Moreda is a senior software engineer currently working for IBM Research.
Before the opportunity of delving into Quantum computing and AI, he was lucky
to explore different roles in the software industry, pivoting towards QA and
with an emphasis on Python and Open Source technologies.

https://twitter.com/diegoplan9
https://github.com/diego-plan9

18:45 pm - Q&A
All questions can be asked using the Youtube live chat.
Questions will be addressed at the end of the keynote.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
What is PyData? PyData is a group for users and developers of data analysis tools to share ideas and learn from each other. We gather to discuss best practices, new approaches, and emerging technologies for data management, processing, analytics, and visualization. We approach data science using many languages, including (but not limited to) Python, Julia, and R.

title: PyBCN Online: March Meetup
descr:
Good to the last drop: Writing robust Flask and Django apps

In this talk Isaac Evans from r2c will walk us through an overview of web security, common gotchas, overview of the tooling, 10 core checks for Flask / Django / others.

r2c is a startup working to profoundly improve software security and reliability to safeguard human progress. We are a team of AppSec engineers and program analysis experts. Having analyzed thousands of open source projects and spoken with hundreds of Python developers, we identified common security pitfalls that are specific to Python web apps. We partnered with authors of major web frameworks to identify common “gotchas” and create a set of best practices for building robust Python web apps. The talk will include:
- Brief overview of common security problems (OWASP Top 10)
- Common gotchas for Flask and Django
- Tools for robust Python backend development
- Q&A session

Isaac is the leader of r2c, a small startup working on giving security tools directly to developers. Previously, he conducted research into binary exploitation bypasses for techniques like control-flow integrity and novel hardware defenses on new architectures like RISC-V as a researcher at the US Defense Department under a SFS program and at MIT Lincoln Laboratory. Isaac received his BS/MS degrees in EECS from MIT. Other interests include next-generation programming languages, secure-by-design frameworks, software-defined radio, and the intersection of cryptography and public policy.

This talk will be in English.

----------

The talk will be online in YouTube (THE CURRENT URL IS A PLACEHOLDER THAT WILL BE MODIFIED CLOSER TO THE EVENT DATE)

You will be able to ask written questions during and after the talk in our Slack, in the channel #meetups If you are not a member of our Slack, don't worry, we will send the invite link to all attendees before the talk.

title: Cursos Escuela de APIs 2021 - Con Certificación
descr:
Conviértete en un profesional cualificado para definir y documentar perfectamente las APIs.

¿Cómo certificarte?

La Fundación APIAddicts imparte una serie de cursos para enseñar a definir correctamente las API teniendo en cuenta todos los aspectos tanto en la definición, seguridad y prueba.

Impartidos por expertos en la materia: Marco A. Sanz, David Marín, Rafael Granados, Omar del Valle e Isabelle Mauny. Obtendrás la certificación API Owner y puedes acceder al Diploma API Evangelist, la máxima certificación.

RESERVA TU PLAZA YA - https://www.eventbrite.es/e/entradas-apiaddicts-cursos-escuela-de-apis-2021-141315645901

CURSOS 2021:

1. Curso API Owner Fundamentals (10h) CON CERTIFICACIÓN

Fecha - 22 al 16 de Marzo de 2021

Curso sobre los fundamentos de las APIs (API Governance, API Definition, API Security, API Testing y API Strategies). Te otorga una visión global del gobierno de APIs, recorrido por el API Manager, las mejores prácticas, Open API, Autenticación Unit Testing/TDD, Estrategias de reporting utilizando los YAML’s, Diseño Agile... y mucho más.

2. Cursos de Especialización (10h / 40% práctica cada curso)

Para la realización de estos cursos de especialización se necesita contar con la certificación API Owner (o bien haciendo el curso o presentándose solo al examen). Son 4 especialidades (API Security, API Design, API Testing y API Architecture) y cada curso tiene su certificación de especialización individual.

Si se supera con éxito los 4 cursos de especialización obtendrá automáticamente el Diploma de API Evangelist.

· API Security (12 al 16 de Abril 2021)

- Conceptos generales
- Principales ataques
- Autenticación
- Autorización
- API Managers

· API Design (26 al 30 de Abril 2021)

- Buenas prácticas en diseño de APIs REST
- Análisis de dominio
- OpenAPI v3 en profundidad

· API Testing: (10 al 14 de Mayo 2021)

- Definition testing: API Tools
- TDD para el desarrollo de APIs: node + postman
- Integration testing: API Tools
- BDD para pruebas de flujo End-to-end
- Performance testing: postman + k6

· API Architecture (24 al 28 de Mayo 2021)

- Creando una API from the scratch
- Plataforma de Desarrollo API
- Plataforma de Runtime o API GATEWAY
- API Portal o Developer Portal
- API Insights o la correcta toma de decisiones
- Patrones API
- Versionado API
- Testing
- El mundo asíncrono

RESERVA TU PLAZA YA - https://www.eventbrite.es/e/entradas-apiaddicts-cursos-escuela-de-apis-2021-141315645901

MÁS INFORMACIÓN - contacta@apiaddicts.org
¡¡Vamos APIAddict, ¿a qué esperas para conseguir tu certificación?

title: Mesa redonda: Fomento de la Diversidad en las Empresas Tecnológicas
descr:
El martes 23 de Marzo tendrá lugar el primer evento de la serie DiversIT. Esta serie está organizada por un conjunto de comunidades tecnológicas con el objetivo de divulgar y promover la inclusión y la diversidad en el sector IT.

Este primer evento será una Mesa Redonda donde expertas en RRHH, así como programadoras que han vivido todo el proceso de selección e inclusión en estos departamentos, comentarán acerca de la situación actual de esta realidad.

Se tratarán temas como el papel de la mujer y otros colectivos infrarrepresentados en las empresas del sector IT, la importancia de la diversidad para el crecimiento empresarial, las best practices en la gestión de la Diversidad en las empresas, ruptura de estereotipos... También podremos conocer nuevos e innovadores modelos para garantizar la igualdad de oportunidades en los procesos de selección y las políticas de retención de talento femenino y otras minorías.

Además de todo ello, este evento busca ser una referencia e inspiración para continuar con la inclusión de estos perfiles en las empresas.

No lo pienses más y únete a esta mesa redonda donde podrás compartir tus opiniones y dudas al respecto, ¡te esperamos!

title: CARTIER-IA platform: a platform for the management of medical data and imaging
descr:
PyData Salamanca is proud to announce a new meetup!

All the talks will be streamed on our Youtube channel.

Youtube Live link: https://youtu.be/475my9vk6Q8

AGENDA

18:00 pm - Keynote (Spanish)
Title: CARTIER-IA platform: a platform for the management of medical data and imaging.

Abstract:
Artificial Intelligence (AI) is growing in popularity due to its support of to complex tasks in different context. Several domains benefit from the application of advanced algorithms and models to their specific problems. One of these domains is the medical sector, where these algorithms can support disease detection, image segmentation and other multiple tasks. However, the intrinsic heterogeneity of medical data makes the application of AI solutions a complex job. In this presentation, we will review the design decisions taken for the implementation of the CARTIER-IA platform: a platform for the management of medical data and imaging with the goal of applying AI algorithms on the unified resources in a straight-forward way.

Speaker: Andrea Vázquez-Ingelmo received the bachelor’s degree in computer engineering from the University of Salamanca, Salamanca, in 2016 and the master’s degree in computer engineering from the same university in 2018. She is a member of the Research Group of Interaction and eLearning (GRIAL), where she is pursuing her PhD degree in computer science. Her area of research is related to human-computer interaction, software engineering, information visualization and machine learning applications.

18:45 pm - Q&A
All questions can be asked using the Youtube live chat.
Questions will be addressed at the end of the keynote.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
What is PyData? PyData is a group for users and developers of data analysis tools to share ideas and learn from each other. We gather to discuss best practices, new approaches, and emerging technologies for data management, processing, analytics, and visualization. We approach data science using many languages, including (but not limited to) Python, Julia, and R.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

descr:

Esperem veure'ns-hi!
La organització

title: PyBCN Online: May Meetup
descr:
Sam Scott (https://twitter.com/samososos), CTO at oso, an NYC-based startup building an open source policy engine for authorization, will help us understand authorization models in Python applications.

Title:

Adding structure to a sea of chaos: a principled approach to authorization using Python + SQLAlchemy

Abstract:

Authorization is an unstructured problem. Writing code to decide who can do what in your app can cover a broad set of cases. The most structure that typically gets applied to this problem area is a set of if statements and roles, but in reality, there are a lot more patterns and structure that we can apply. oso is an open source system for building authorization into applications. It's a bit like SQLAlchemy in that it provides a structured approached to authorization, much like SQLAlchemy does for data modeling and access. In this talk, we'll provide a mental model for authorization and show how to apply it using oso, Python and SQLAlchemy.

This talk will be in English.

About oso: https://www.osohq.com/
Documentation: https://docs.osohq.com/

----------

The talk will be online in YouTube (THE CURRENT URL IS A PLACEHOLDER THAT WILL BE MODIFIED CLOSER TO THE EVENT DATE)

You will be able to ask written questions during and after the talk in our Slack, in the channel #meetups If you are not a member of our Slack, don't worry, we will send the invite link to all attendees before the talk.

----------

# More

title: Reinterpretación del Gradient Boosting como modelo explicable
descr:
PyData Salamanca is proud to announce a new meetup!

All the talks will be streamed on our Youtube channel.

Youtube Live link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KcbR32xjMw

AGENDA

19:00 pm - Keynote (Spanish)
Title: Reinterpretación del Gradient Boosting como modelo explicable.

Abstract:
En los últimos años ha habido un auge en la aparición de modelos de machine learning que han demostrado dar grandes resultados a nivel predictivo, como por ejemplo el Gradient Boosting (GB). Actualmente, uno de los retos es entender en qué se basan estos modelos para hacer esas predicciones. Nuestro objetivo es, reintepretrar el algoritmo de aprendizaje del GB de modo que, sin modificar sus predicciones ni sus propiedades, la causa de sus predicciones sea entendible por una persona

Speakers:
- Bea Hernández, senior Data Scientist en UrbanDataAnalytics donde desarrolla modelos para el mercado inmobiliario. Fundó de R-Ladies Madrid y habla con gatos. Twitter: @Chucheria
- Ángel Delgado. AI Engineer en Plain Concepts. Estudié Física y lo cuento en twitter @thinbaker

title: Google I/O Extended Keynote 2021
descr:
Benvolgut/da:
Fa mesos que no organitzem trobades presencials com a conseqüència de les restriccions imposades per reduïr l'impacte del COVID-19. Esperem que tots estigueu bé, i que ben aviat poguem tornar a veure'ns.

Mentres i tant, Google organitza un any més el I/O 2021, la presentació de nous productes i serveis orientats als desenvolupadors i entusiastes d'aquestes tecnologies.

La Keynote del dia 18 de maig serà el tret de sortida d'una serie d'events que duraran fins el dia 20, i tots seran virtuals i estan a la vostra disposició en aquest link:
https://events.google.com/io/program/schedule.

Per participar virtualment a la Keynote us oferim dues possibilitats:
a) Visionar-la en l'enllaç a Youtube que properament s'anunciarà i que us podeu programar al calendari, o ...
b) Participar en la xerrada i col·loqui que el GDG Lleida farà en streaming a: https://youtu.be/YxaFGPkQc14
Els amics del GDG Lleida són col·laboradors habituals, i l'Andreu Ibañez ha asistit els últims anys presencialment a les Keynotes i ens explicarà anècdotes.

Finalment, donat que els grups de GDG d'arreu deixarem d'usar la plataforma MeetUp, us demanem que ens seguiu a Twitter (@GDGGirona), ja que usarem aquesta plataforma per comunicar-nos amb vosaltres.

Esperem retrobar-nos ben aviat!

Salutacions!

title: Cursos API Owner + Especializaciones = Certificación API Evangelist
descr:
Conviértete en un profesional cualificado para a definir y documentar perfectamente las APIs.

¿Cómo certificarte?

Cursos 100% bonificables por la FUNDAE
La Fundación APIAddicts imparte una serie de cursos para enseñar a gestionar todo el proceso de APIficación dentro de una empresa.

Están impartidos por expertos en la materia como Marco A. Sanz, David Marín, Rafael Granados, Luis Torres, Jacob de las Peñas, Omar del Valle e Isabelle Mauny.

Puedes realizar el curso de referencia en APIs: API Owner Fundamentals y complementar tu formación con los Cursos de Especialización (Security, Testing, Architecture y Design)

1. Curso API Owner Fundamentals (9h):
Del 25 al 27 de Octubre de 2021

Curso sobre los fundamentos de las APIs (Governance, Definition, Security, Testing, Strategy y API First). Te otorga una visión global del gobierno de APIs, recorrido por el API Manager, las mejores prácticas, Open API, Autenticación Unit Testing/TDD, Estrategias de reporting utilizando los YAML’s, Diseño Agile... y mucho más.

Con certificación. - Te permite obtener el diploma API Evangelist con el resto de cursos de Especialización.

2. Cursos de Especialización (9h / 40% práctica cada curso):

Para la realización de estos cursos de especialización se necesita contar con la certificación API Owner. Son 4 especialidades (API Security, API Design, API Testing y API Architecture) y cada curso tiene su certificación de especialización individual.

Si se supera con éxito los 4 cursos de especialización obtendrá automáticamente el Diploma de API Evangelist.

· API Architecture - 8 al 10 de Noviembre 2021

- Creando una API from the scratch
- Plataforma de Desarrollo API
- Plataforma de Runtime o API GATEWAY
- API Portal o Developer Portal
- API Insights o la correcta toma de decisiones
- Patrones API
- Versionado API
- Testing
- El mundo asíncrono

· API Design - 15 al 17 de Noviembre 2021

- Buenas prácticas en diseño de APIs REST
- Análisis de dominio
- OpenAPI v3 en profundidad

· API Architecture - 22 al 24 de Noviembre 2021

- Definition testing: API Tools
- TDD para el desarrollo de APIs: node + postman
- Integration testing: API Tools
- BDD para pruebas de flujo End-to-end
- Performance testing: postman + k6

· API Security - 29 al 01 de Diciembre 2021

- Conceptos generales
- Principales ataques
- Autenticación
- Autorización
- API Managers

Si tienes cualquier duda, ponte en contacto con nosotros - contacta@apiaddicts.org

Ya van 5 ediciones, ¿A qué esperas para conseguir tu certificación?
¡¡Te esperamos, APIAddict!!

title: GeeksCAT :: Data Science :: #03 Lector de matrícules emprant Python
descr:
Deep Learning en una Dashcam emprant Python: Lector de matrícules

Sessió del grup de treball sobre Data Science de l'Associació GeeksCAT (https://geekscat.org) on en Josep Oriol Ayats (https://github.com/joseporiolayats) ens explicarà com aplicar DL sobre una dashcam per fer funcionar un lector de matrícules.

Farem un projecte complert: aconseguirem les dades, el codi, el framework i articularem el procés de crear una xarxa neuronal amb Pytorch per detectar i llegir matrícules.

Live a https://www.twitch.tv/ayatsdev/

title: Integrando Neo4j y Python: un caso basado en datos de contrataciones públicas
descr:
PyData Salamanca is proud to announce a new meetup!

All the talks will be streamed on our Youtube channel.

Youtube Live link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JzPts2mIyP8

AGENDA

19:00 pm - Keynote (Spanish)
Title: Integrando Neo4j y Python: un caso basado en datos de contrataciones públicas.

Abstract:
En los últimos años las bases de datos de grafos han ganado un tremendo impulso debido a su capacidad y flexibilidad para modelar fenómenos en red. En esta sesión Dagoberto y Ricardo nos mostrarán cómo el uso combinado de Neo4j y Python proporciona un poderoso arsenal de herramientas para el análisis de sistemas complejos, como es el caso de una red de contratación pública.

Speakers:
Dagoberto Herrera (profesor de Ciencia de Datos en ULACIT Costa Rica) y Ricardo Araya (estudiante del grado en Inteligencia de Negocios por la misma universidad)

Contest:
Entre los participantes que realicen una reseña pública del evento en Twitter, Facebook, Instagram o LinkedIn usando los hashtags #Python #Neo4j #PyData_SAL_CR estaremos rifando tres cursos de UDEMY en ciencia de datos, inteligencia artificial o programación.

19:45 pm - Q&A
All questions can be asked using the Youtube live chat.
Questions will be addressed at the end of the keynote.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
What is PyData? PyData is a group for users and developers of data analysis tools to share ideas and learn from each other. We gather to discuss best practices, new approaches, and emerging technologies for data management, processing, analytics, and visualization. We approach data science using many languages, including (but not limited to) Python, Julia, and R.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

FUTURE SPEAKERS

Would you like to speak at this meetup or a future one? Please submit your proposal at coordinaciondatalabgmailcom

title: Giving automated tests the love they deserve at Listings (talk in Catalan)
descr:
Hola!

Aquest dimecres en Jordi Pradel ens explicarà com han enfocat el testing de software a un parell d'equips de LIFULL Connect.

En Jordi és un vallesià fill d'un fill del Carrer dels Alemanys de Girona, i es va formar a la UPC a Barcelona. El 2005 va fundar Agilogy per ajudar a equips i companyies a fer desenvolupament àgil de software, centrant-se en la part tecnològica, la orientació a valor i la qualitat del software.

És un entusiasta de la tecnologia i està fascinat per la programació funcional, CQRS, DDD, cloud computing i tot tipus de coses "guais" per l'estil.

L'enfocament al testing de software que ha estat a aplicant a Lifullconnect s'allunya d'algunes convencions molt establertes per centrar-se en una piràmide de test que no ho és, la inversió en el millor cicle de feedback possible, unes proves "broad stack" ultra-ràpides i una build preparada per provar només allò que ha canviat.

Esperem veure-us-hi!

Xavi

title: GeeksCAT - 1ª Festa OpenSource Girona
descr:
Més informació a https://hacktoberfest.geekscat.org

Registre obligatori a https://www.eventbrite.es/e/entradas-festa-opensource-girona-2021-geekscat-187819452037

## Què farem?

Trobada presencial. Disposarem de sales on s'impartiran diverses xerrades relacionades amb la tech i l'OpenSource.

Paral·lelament, qui vulgui podrà dedicar l'estona a contribuir amb l'OS. Hi haurà mentors que ajudaran a qui ho necessiti.

Tancarem amb una taula rodona; la idea és anar desgranant les diferents dimensions del món FLOSS. Tindrem diversos ponents convidats que analitzaran des de la seva perspectiva les diferents implicacions de l'OpenSource.

Per la tarda i en paral·lel a les xerrades i a la marató tindrà lloc el taller d'introducció a Django on se seguirà parcialment el tutorial de les Django Girls

## Agenda

09:30 - Obertura de portes
10:00 - Kickoff
11:00 - Home Assistant @jbagot
12:00 - Deepf*cking al cloud @joseporiolayats
13:00 - Dinar (lliure)
15:00 - Syncthing @festuc
15:30 - Depurant la gameboy amb r2frida @trufae aka pancake
16:00 - SonicPi @victormartingarcia
17:00 - Com muntar-te la teva pròpia CI/CD OS? @xavitorello
18:00 - Taula Rodona sobre OS
19:00 - Tancament

De 10:00 a 18:00 tindrem habilitada una sala per la marató de PRs. Farem petites xerrades sobre git, github/gitlab, com fer una PR? com cercar issues/projectes als que col·laborar, ...

De 15:00 a 18:00 s'impartirà el taller `"Intro a Django`" (registre obligatori reservant entrada, limitat a 15 assistents). Seguirem parcialment el tutorial de les Django Girls, farem grups petits amb un mentor que ajudarà a l'equip a assolir els reptes del taller. Organitzen els amics de @PyCamp i @argenpython

## Quan ho farem?

El dissabte 23 d'Octubre, al Centre Cultural la Mercè, de Girona.

La jornada començarà a les 10h i acabarem a les 19h.

## Normes de seguretat

Per tal que l’esdeveniment es desenvolupi amb normalitat, caldrà seguir les normes bàsiques de seguretat per al COVID-19:

L'aforament estarà limitat seguint la limitació establerta per l'AdG
Dur mascareta
Mantenir la distància de seguretat de 1.5m
Rentar-se sovint les mans
Utiltizar gel desinfectant
Vetllant per la seguretat no podrem oferir càtering ni res per picar.

Els que vulguem podrem anar plegats a dinar a algun restaurant de la zona.

title: PyBCN Online: October Meetup
descr:
PyBCN members David Arcos (https://twitter.com/dzpm), Ruben Berenguel (https://twitter.com/berenguel) and Alberto Cámara ((https://twitter.com/b3r2s)) will explore PyBCN via a technique known as Wardley Mapping. This will help us understand the technique and the many moving pieces this association has.

Title:

Wardley mapping the Python Barcelona Association

Abstract:

Wardley mapping is a visual technique to analyse certain "problem spaces", like businesses, security and others. It is very helpful in providing a share understanding of the problem and also in finding new areas to explore, issues to fix and potential wins. In our case (aside from explaining the technique for everybody!) we want to see what we can learn together about how PyBCN works, how we can make it more efficient and better for all our members.

This talk/round table will be in Catalan.

----------

The talk will be online and hosted in Zoom (THE CURRENT URL IS A PLACEHOLDER THAT WILL BE MODIFIED CLOSER TO THE EVENT DATE)

You will be able to ask written questions during and after the talk in the Zoom event.

----------

# More
- Our Code of Conduct: https://pybcn.org/coc/

title: Tennis kata (Presencial) + Pizzes gentilesa de Sunweb
descr:
Una kata és un petit exercici de programació que ajuda als programadors a perfeccionar les seves habilitats mitjançant la pràctica i la repetició.

Tennis Kata és una Kata orientada a practicar el Test Driven Development (TDD). L'objectiu d'aquesta quedada és simplement assentar-nos i fer-la tots (sols, en parelles, amb qui et vulguis associar) al mateix lloc i comentar la jugada, no té massa més aspiracions.
Si tens ganes de practicar amb nosaltres, uneix-te!

Farem la variant de refactoring basada en aquest repo, disponible en 25 llenguatges diferents: https://github.com/emilybache/Tennis-Refactoring-Kata

Horari:
19:00 - 19:15 - Introducció al grup (és la primera trobada presencial!) i a la Kata
19:15 - 21:00 - Kata
21:00 - 22:30 - Pizzes gentilesa de Sunweb que també cedeix les seves oficines per l'event

Què has de portar?
Si la vols fer sol necessitaràs portar un portàtil amb IDE que et permeti executar tests unitaris. El llenguatge de programació l'esculls tu.

I si no tens portàtil o no saps fer tests unitaris i en vols aprendre, vine igualment. Segur que trobes algu disposat a fer pairing amb tu (si el pots convèncer per fer servir el teu llenguatge de programació i IDE ja serà un altre tema :-) )

Lloc:
El proper dia Dimecres 24 a les 19:00 a les oficines de Sunweb.

Places limitades, en cas de reservar i no poder venir, si's plau allibereu la plaça.

title: WordPressformance 🚀 Millora els Core Web Vitals i el Pagespeed del teu lloc web
descr:
WordPressformance
-----------------

És WordPress lent? Depèn. De què depèn? De segons com es miri.

WordPress ha llançat un equip de treball en la Comunitat especialitzat en Performance. Ara com ara ha començat amb uns pocs elements, però sabem que afecta a pràcticament tot.

Vols saber com es planteja aquest nou equip i en què treballarà? Vols avançar-te a aquest canvi i començar a millorar ja els Core Web Vitals i el Pagespeed?

Farem un repàs de tots els elements que més afecten l'optimització d'un lloc web amb WordPress i veurem, en una demostració pràctica, com amb algunes eines, plugins i configuracions podem optimitzar el nostre lloc.

Tant si ets una persona amb coneixements tècnics com si no, és la teva oportunitat d'optimitzar el teu lloc web amb WordPress o les instal·lacions dels teus clients!

😀 Ponent:
— Javier Casares

🤓 Nivell / Temàtica:
— Bàsic / Intermig / Alt
— Tècnic / Sistemes

⏰ Horari:
- 19:00 Benvinguda
- 19:10 Meetup

Gràcies als nostres col·laboradors de sempre: el Co-Espai, espai de coworking al centre de Girona i a l'associació de professionals Digitals Girona, ens fa molta il·lusió tornar a trobar-nos per una meetup presencial!

Si t'interessa patrocinar aquesta meetup, posa't en contacte amb els organitzadors via missatge privat :)

title: Python November Meetup (in person!)
descr:
➡️ Talks

1️⃣ Property-based testing with hypothesis
📢 Speaker: Alberto Cámara (🐦 @b3r2s)
⏱Duration: Around 30 minutes
🗣Language: English

💡 Property-based testing is an approach to writing unit tests where, instead of using specific examples, we focus on specifying properties which we expect to hold in all cases. This allows for systematic checks against a multitude of examples and quickly finding errors and edge cases.

We will introduce Hypothesis, a library which allows for property-based testing in a very succint way by integrating with pytest.

---

2️⃣ Serverless WebApp using GoogleAppEngine
📢 Speakers: Victor Pérez (🐙 @vperezb) and Carlos Gálvez, from Tiendeo
⏱Duration: Around 30 minutes
🗣Language: Spanish

💡 Cómo hemos usado en Tiendeo la suite de Google Cloud (AppEngine, Datastore, Storage) para el prototipado y despliegue de aplicaciones web y como ha evolucionado el proyecto bcnmarket.barcelona para soportar el incremento de tráfico. Reestructuración del repositorio, mejora de la caché, colas (RabbitMQ), indexado a Elastic, API-Swagger, Celery

title: Sing a song Kata
descr:
Hola!

El pròxim Dimarts (que no Dimecres com era habitual) 21 de Desembre quedarem en línia per fer la Kata "Sing a Song", de forma acompanyada (que no guiada). És una Kata de (P)Refactoring que es pot fer en múltiples llenguates.

La intenció és organitzar-nos en grups de 2-3 persones per fer-la (els llenguatges de programació i IDEs es decidiran en el moment i segons els grups).

Començarem a les 21:30 fent directament els grups i ja ens hi posarem tant ràpid com puguem. Un cop acabada la Kata (o el temps que pretenem dedicar-hi) la farem petar una estona online.

Demanem a tothom que assisteixi que tingui el següent setup configurat per poder compartir codi i pantalla amb algu.
- Visual Studio Code + Live Share + Compte de GitHub o Microsoft, necessari per poder editar codi en una sessió LiveShare iniciada per un altre usuari.
- Alternativament, IntelliJ.
- Scaffolding de l'entorn de treball amb testos unitaris (més info en aquests links p.e.):
- https://github.com/GA1/algo-tdd-starters
- https://github.com/glippi/kataclism

Esperem veure'ns-hi!
Xavi

title: I'm Tracing you! A story about Observability and OpenTelemetry
descr:
Eyyy devs !!!! New year and new event at the BarcelonaJUG.

Microservices solved a few challenges from traditional architectures, but at the same time they also introduced new ones. These challenges have led to the rise of Observability and the requirement to track exactly what is happening across the entire system. OpenTelemetry and Distributed Tracing come to the rescue and provide us with a set of events describing the operations being executed in our applications. Do not worry, even if you are not using Microservices you can still use OpenTelemetry.
In this session, you can expect multiple demos showing how to use OpenTelemetry in new and old applications alike, without even having to change you code!

This talk will be conducted by Roberto Cortez, Principal Software Engineer at Red Hat.

title: Product Management. “La complejidad del rol de Product Owner” (Evento ONLINE)
descr:
Hola,

InnoIT Consulting está encantado de recibir a Gerard Chiva de Aktia Solutions para nuestro Webinar del próximo Jueves 3 de Febrero a las 18:30h:

Product Management. “La complejidad del rol de Product Owner” (Evento ONLINE)

CUANDO: Jueves 3 de Febrero de 18:30h a 19:30h
DONDE: Online (Zoom) - https://us02web.zoom.us/j/81681848831?pwd=YkcvWG5BL2NJN2xIM0NQVGlxdHhCUT09
Idioma de la presentación: Castellano

Temática:

Comprender la verdadera complejidad del rol de Product Owner es fundamental para el diseño de los equipos de producto, el desarrollo profesional de los Product Owners y el crecimiento de negocio.

En esta charla de 50 minutos veremos cómo garantizar el encaje del rol, minimizar el tiempo de ramp-up y mejorar la eficacia de los equipos de producto en 3 ejes:

Crecimiento:
Los Product Owners evolucionan junto con la mentalidad de producto de su organización.

Especialización:
El Product Managament aún no tienen especialidades definidas. Los problemas surgen cuando pensamos que todos los roles de Product Owner son iguales

Liderazgo:
El rol de Product Owner es esencialmente un rol de liderazgo. Gestiona un producto pero debe liderar personas, sin autoridad formal. Cuanto antes empiece a desarrollar las competencias de liderazgo mucho mejor.

Nuestro Speaker:

Gerard Chiva es Managing Director y Co-founder de Aktia Solutions. Es Product Coach, Lean & Agile Coach, Team & Executive Coach, inversor y advisor de startups.

Audiencia. Este webinar está orientado a:
• Product Owners
• Project Managers
• Business Owners/ IT Manager/ IT Lead/ CIO & CTO
• Product Directors / Head of Product / Chief Product Officer
• Perfiles técnicos con ganas de pasar a gestión de producto
• Product Managers tradicionales que quieran acercarse a la gestión moderna de producto

title: moinworld meets Thoughtworks: Responsible Tech - from Purpose to Practice
descr:
Thoughtworks is partnering with moinworld to increase the number of women in technology and motivate girls for tech careers.

Today we want to discuss how we can use technology to reshape our world in a good way.

This Meetup is the opportunity to learn about responsible tech and and how we can think beyond our immediate product goals.

Technology is reshaping our world. Technologists have the power to help prevent devastating impacts on identity, health, business, political systems and social cohesion, simply by applying ethical thinking and the right methods.

How can we anticipate the consequences and mitigate any harms of our products?

Given what we are seeing out there in the world it is time to think a little bit more deeply about what we are building as good intentions are no longer enough.
Ultimately it’ll be better for us and better for the organisations we work for.

Agenda:

7:00 Hello from moinworld and Thoughtworks

7:10 “AI and Racial Bias” with Oyidiya Oji (Data scientist & Analyst)

7:30 “Towards more responsible Tech” with Alexander Steinhart (Product consultant @ Thoughtworks)

7:50 Q & A

8:10 Virtual Networking

8:30 Good Bye and See you next time!

Our Speakers:

Alexander Steinhart (Psychologist & Technologist, Thoughtworks)

The editor of Thoughtworks' Responsible tech playbook, Alexander's passion is in realigning tech with humanity's interests. As a consultant, Alexander plays a variety of product roles for Thoughtworks' clients in Germany.

Oyidiya Oji (Data scientist & Analyst)

Oyidiya is a data scientist and analyst who builds relationships between technology and civil society at Espai Societat Oberta. She is passionate about data and her curiosity made her discover that tech products are not yet made for everyone. She brings awareness to topics like antiracism, algorithmic biases, and the importance of a DEI perspective.

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is a free event but PLEASE RSVP directly at the event page linked below:
>>>Register here: https://www.meetup.com/de-DE/womentechmakershamburg/events/281667983/
-----------------------------------------------------------------

For more information about moinworld. e.V please visit: https://moinworld.de/

title: Se hace el equipo al andar
descr:
¿Qué es un equipo?¿Qué necesita para que pueda considerarse sano y efectivo?¿Qué puede aportar y cómo puede contribuir cada uno de sus integrantes para que el equipo esté preparado de cara a los retos a los que necesita enfrentarse?
Además de trabajar los retos y los objetivos ¿cómo podemos construir una cultura de equipo sólida? ¿Cómo trabajamos la misión y gestionamos los recursos de los que dispone el equipo para ser efectivo?

De nuevo en esta ocasión contamos con la colaboración de Agile Sur para esta charla, en la que responderemos a estas preguntas y veremos algunas herramientas útiles con las que contribuir a una mejor salud y efectividad de los equipos.

Todo ello con un enfoque práctico y compartiendo nuestra experiencia con aquellas técnicas, dinámicas o consejos que nos han sido útiles para construir esa cultura de misión de equipo.

By Fran Ávila, Software Craftsperson en Codurance Spain

Fran ha sido desarrollador de software, formador, director de ingeniería, arquitecto de software, agilista ... Ha trabajado en diferentes sectores: medios de comunicación, telecomunicaciones, académico, militar, gaming y retail entre otros. Cuenta con más de 17 años de experiencia en el sector tecnológico, tanto en la parte técnica como en la de gestión de proyectos y en la organizacional. Actualmente es uno de los responsables de proyecto en el equipo de Codurance Spain.

title: SPArtacUX, the project that brought web performance to the heart of ManoMano UX
descr:
Hi,

InnoIT Consulting is delighted to host Josselin Buils, FrontEnd developer @ManoMano for our next meetup online on Wednesday, February 16th at 18h30.

New Technology. SPArtacUX, the project that brought web performance to the heart of ManoMano UX

WHEN: Wednesday, February 16th at 18h30 (50min speech & 10min questions)
WHERE: Webinar. Please subscribe ASAP on this link: https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_Nh4MCHPjQXCNDNnK2a4rNA
Language: English. Free of charge.
Feel free to circulate it among your colleagues and network.

Summary:
March 2020, first lockdown, stores are closed, people are DIYing… Consequence: the explosion of the ManoMano website traffic. Boosted by several reflections before the crisis, we take the decision to start from scratch to make the ManoMano website a reference in terms of performance. I will share with you how we chose and implemented the new technical stack in record time, and why combining experience and performance can be complex.

Speaker's bio:
Josselin has been a front-end developer at ManoMano for 3 years. He actively participated in the redesign of the website via the SPArtacUX project, especially in the implementation of the new front stack with performance and developer experience as key targets.
His profile: https://www.linkedin.com/in/josselinbuils/

See you there!
InnoIT Consulting & Josselin Buils

title: Frozen DevOps? Team Topologies Comes to the Rescue!
descr:
Why are so many organizations stuck in the "middle" of DevOps evolution? What's preventing them from achieving higher levels of organizational performance despite all the automation, tooling, and good practices in place?

Puppet's State of DevOps Report 2021 provides essential research-based clues to answer these questions, supported by the patterns and recommendations in Team Topologies.

This talk covers the self-imposed limitations of blindly following some "myths" around DevOps. Almost 80% of organizations are stuck in the "frozen middle" of DevOps evolution because of a lack of organizational sensemaking abilities. The margin for growth for these organizations is tremendous. Still, they need to think beyond technical capabilities to unlock the potential of their teams to deliver with more autonomy and a sense of purpose.

The data shows that Team Topologies provides the necessary organizational and team interaction patterns that help organizations achieve performance metrics such as delivering a new customer change request to live in under one hour, or diagnosing and recovering from a severe issue in production in under an hour.

Get the State of DevOps Report 2021 here:
https://puppet.com/resources/report/2021-state-of-devops-report

To learn more about Team Topologies:
https://teamtopologies.com/learn
https://academy.teamtopologies.com

Manuel Pais

Manuel Pais is co-author of Team Topologies: organizing business and technology teams for fast flow. Recognized by TechBeacon as a DevOps thought leader, Manuel is an independent IT organizational consultant and trainer, focused on team interactions, delivery practices, and accelerating flow. Manuel is also a LinkedIn instructor on Continuous Delivery.

title: Introduction to Apache Airflow: author, schedule and monitor workflows
descr:
Apache Airflow is one of the most popular tools for implementing data engineering, machine learning, and DevOps workflows, and it is used by more than 200 companies such as Airbnb, Yahoo, Paypal, Intel or Stripe.

Airflow allows to programmatically **author, schedule and monitor workflows**, which are sequence of tasks, started on a schedule or triggered by an event, and it is frequently used to handle big data processing pipelines.

We are going to work with Airflow from scratch and write our first DAG, accordingly to:
\- airflow operators\,
\- operators that we write by ourselves\,
\- our own pipelines\, using a small operator\.

If time permits, we are also going to find out how to add operators using MongoDB operators.

**What to bring:**
This is an IN-PERSON hands-on workshop, so you will need to bring your own laptop.

**Requirements:**
Follow the instructions to install some packages and let's work as much as possible! (https://gitlab.com/ebuitragod/airflow-playground/-/blob/master/paso-a-paso.txt" class="linkified">https://gitlab.com/ebuitragod/airflow-playground/-/blob/master/paso-a-paso.txt](https://gitlab.com/ebuitragod/airflow-playground/-/blob/master/paso-a-paso.txt)

**Level**: Intermediate
**Language**: English

title: Mobile Product strategy learnings from Free Now, Glovo & ManoMano (meetup)
descr:
InnoIT Consulting & French Tech Barcelona are delighted to invite you to our Meetup on Monday February 28th at 18h30:

Mobile Product Strategy. “Mobile Product strategy learnings from Free Now, Glovo & ManoMano" (Presencial Event)

Due to the Mobile World Congress, we wanted to celebrate this kind of topic with 3 great speakers from FreeNow, Glovo and ManoMano.
We invite you to join and share with us. This meetup is addressed to the Product Mobile community and to all the entrepreneurs, managers that are currently crafting their mobile strategy.

WHEN: Monday February 28th at 18h30 (1h meetup & 1,5h networking)
WHERE: “Aticco Co-Working Bogatell » Calle de Pallars, 108, 08018 Barcelona
Language: English. Free of charges.
We have a capacity limit: max 80 people

Content
TALK #1 "Impacts & learnings from the integration of mobile apps in our existing Tech product"
By Julie Colin, Head of Product @ ManoMano

A bit more than 2 years ago, we decided to develop our own Mobile Apps. It was a really bold decision as it had an impact on our Product organization, on our whole internal Tech ecosystem and even on the Customer Journey, but still it was a great move.
In this presentation, I'll be pleased to share why, all the generated learnings and finally some key best practices to successfully launch Mobile Apps.
This talk is addressed to tech companies that are currently designing their Mobile App strategy. This is also a call for joining the discussion to all teams that have already experienced this situation.

TALK #2 by Marta ROS, Director of Product (Supply) at FREE NOW (linkedin.com/in/martarosurrutia)
FreeNow is halfway through the journey of going from a feature factory to a dual-track approach by building real empowered product teams.
I will explain where are we today and the key steps we are taking.

TALK #3 "Balancing business requirements and tech scalability in mobile Apps"
By Roldan GALAN, Staff Software Engineer at GLOVO (linkedin.com/in/rolgalan)
Every startup begins iterating quickly a MVP and building as many features as possible, introducing lots of tech debt. While this is really needed at the beginning stage to validate the product, once it start expanding it needs to consolidate with a scalable architecture and engineering practices that will allow the company to grow up to the moon.
How do you keep delivering fast in a really competitive market without compromising the quality of the product?
How do you ensure teams autonomy as you build a team 10x larger? In this talk we will discuss the learnings applied to the Glovo mobile app during the last 4 years of fast growth.

See you there!
InnoIT Team & French Tech Barcelona

title: A GraphQL-based Schema Architecture for Microservices
descr:
Message and Event payload validation has been a rather thorny problem to deal with for the past 20+ years. Several generations of Schema definition languages such as DTD, XML-schema, json-schema, OpenAPI have tried to solve that problem but their structure remains unfamiliar to most developers and often result in a rather anemic set of validation rules (such as every field is optional), leading to a perceived low value, and therefore a lack of interest.
Regardless of the schema language, there are three key problems that one must solve in a schema architecture:
\- the re\-usability of data structure definitions
\- the expressiveness of the schema language
\- the developer experience

Nav is a Small Business Lending platform built on a polyglot microservice architecture, complemented by an event bus. It is essential for us to develop a consistent way to validate our message payloads (APIs and events) across all microservices.
Considering that it has one of the best DevX in the industry, we got the idea to use GraphQL as a schema language (without any runtime component). After all, a GraphQL query describes the payload requested by a client, so why not use the same syntax to create a message definition and generate client-side and server-side validation code?

Presenter's Bio: Jean-Jacques ("JJ") has been building Service-Oriented Architectures and API platforms for the last 20+ years. He is a former member of the research staff at HRL and earned his Ph.D. from the University of Provence (Luminy campus), home of the Prolog language. He is the author of the SAM Pattern and inventor of the BOLT methodology.

title: Primera kata con Go
descr:
Abrimos nuestro grupo de estudio de GO y os invitamos a la iniciativa. Nos reunimos periódicamente para hacer katas con el lenguaje, compartir lecturas, tips y avances. La idea es darnos soporte para mejorar nuestra experiencia con Go.
